title: Bus leisure route 9: London's Museums and Palaces
description: Take bus route 9 to explore several royal palaces including St James's Palace, Clarence House and Kensington Palace, as well as interesting museums such as the London Transport Museum and the Natural History Museum. The route also includes other famous London landmarks, such as Trafalgar Square, and parks to explore and relax in.

title: Bus leisure route 17: Heritage and Pubs
description: Take bus route 17 and visit some of the oldest pubs in London, the Charles Dickens Museum and St Paul's Cathedral, amongst other historical highlights.

title: Bus leisure route 22: Antiques and Curios
description: Take bus route 22 and explore various antiques shops, art galleries and markets, as well as one of London's most famous shops, Fortnum & Mason. Break up shopping with a palace or park visit.

title: Bus leisure route 35: London's Markets
description: Take bus route 35 and spend a day exploring markets across London, which sell everything from food and flowers, to clothing and gifts.

title: Bus leisure route 139: Classic London
description: Take bus route 139 and see some of the most iconic London attractions, including Piccadilly Circus and Trafalgar Square, and famous shops such as Hamleys Toy Store and Selfridges & Co.
